meanings.definition: A person who believes that Christians are freed from moral law by virtue of grace.
meanings.sent1: The antinomians in the church argued that grace alone was enough to guide their actions.
meanings.sent2: Many antinomians in history have challenged traditional religious teachings.
meanings.sent3: The antinomians at the potluck only ate dessert, claiming they were exempt from dietary rules.
meanings.sent4: Her rebellious nature made her seem like an antinomian in a world of strict rules.
meanings.sent5: The antinomians' belief in grace over law was both liberating and controversial.

meanings.definition: Belonging to or characteristic of antinomians.
meanings.sent1: The antinomians philosophy was evident in their unconventional approach to morality.
meanings.sent2: Her antinomians views often clashed with the more traditional members of the community.
meanings.sent3: The antinomians fashion sense was a mix of bold colors and unique patterns.
meanings.sent4: His antinomians behavior raised eyebrows among the conservative townspeople.
meanings.sent5: The antinomians lifestyle embraced freedom from societal norms.
